page.title: 15WOODLAND
page.content: PENYARD WOODS:approximately 310 acres running adjacent to Chase Woods and overlooking the town of Ross.Evidence of Birch,Maple,Scots Pine, Corsican Pine, Horse Chestnut,Beach,Oak,Syca- more,Ash,English Elm,Hawthorn,Holly, Douglas Fir, Silver Birch,Yew. Dawn Redwood planted in the l950's. Remains of Penyard Castle in evidence although most of the stones were used for build ing the old Rectory and Bollitree Cas- tle at Weston.ALDRICH BLAKES WOODLAND: privately owned by Mrs.Aldrich Blake, approx 232 acres. Running on from Pen- yard Woods on the Weston side.The wood was started with approx.20,000 trees, it now has some 100,000 trees.Until recently between 500 & 10,000 trees would be planted annually. The tallest trees are the oak & sweet chestnut (90 ft.approx).Some seedlings collected by owners & grown in garden for 2-3 years
